GT.content: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift
GT.linkedContent: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift

GT.content: transcendental signified or signifier as general equivalent, “transcendental” makes possible every categorial determination, all givens (to be/to have, thing/person)
GT.linkedContent: transcendental signified or signifier as general equivalent, “transcendental” makes possible every categorial determination, all givens (to be/to have, thing/person)

GT.content: Lacan’s “symbolic order” guards gift against dissemination, against itself
GT.linkedContent: Lacan’s “symbolic order” guards gift against dissemination, against itself

R.content: the unconscious remains the most vital reserve of the self-destructive conservation of the “subject” or of egological ipseity; without autoimmunity, no sadism, masochism, consciousness, death drive
R.linkedContent: the unconscious remains the most vital reserve of the self-destructive conservation of the “subject” or of egological ipseity; without autoimmunity, no sadism, masochism, consciousness, death drive

MONL.content: neither lack nor alienation, alienation without alienation > origin of our responsibility, structures peculiar property of language
MONL.linkedContent: neither lack nor alienation, alienation without alienation > origin of our responsibility, structures peculiar property of language

MONL.content: abiding “alienation” appears constitutive like lack, but it isn’t lack
MONL.linkedContent: abiding “alienation” appears constitutive like lack, but it isn’t lack

MONL.content: [compare Lacan’s Y a d’ l’Un to Derrida’s “there is some language”]
MONL.linkedContent: [compare Lacan’s Y a d’ l’Un to Derrida’s “there is some language”]

MONL.content: [Derrida’s quilting point?] passage points = places of transcendence, absolute elsewhere in eyes of Greco-Latino-Christian philosophy & yet inside it > epekeina tes ousias, khōra, negative theology, Freud, Artaud, Blanchot, Levinas, Eckhart
MONL.linkedContent: [Derrida’s quilting point?] passage points = places of transcendence, absolute elsewhere in eyes of Greco-Latino-Christian philosophy & yet inside it > epekeina tes ousias, khōra, negative theology, Freud, Artaud, Blanchot, Levinas, Eckhart

FL.content: Derrida hesitates to call the readability of violence Lacan’s symbolic order
FL.linkedContent: Derrida hesitates to call the readability of violence Lacan’s symbolic order

LOBL.content: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, there’s a 2nd death after resurrection [Lacan’s btwn 2 deaths]
LOBL.linkedContent: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, there’s a 2nd death after resurrection [Lacan’s btwn 2 deaths]

LOBL.content: there’s an arrêt btwn 2 deaths [in L’arrêt de mort], thus hypertopia [see p. 140]
LOBL.linkedContent: there’s an arrêt btwn 2 deaths [in L’arrêt de mort], thus hypertopia [see p. 140]

LOBL.content: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death, the life the death of the other, the other lives and dies > “for there is an other of the other and it is not the same” [see POO p. 11 “other of the other” is the very undeniable of ethics]
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death, the life the death of the other, the other lives and dies > “for there is an other of the other and it is not the same” [see POO p. 11 “other of the other” is the very undeniable of ethics]

MC.content: the indivisibility of Lacan’s letter creates dogma
MC.linkedContent: the indivisibility of Lacan’s letter creates dogma

MC.content: why the letter, name, is divisible but still iterable (re-markable in its difference)
MC.linkedContent: why the letter, name, is divisible but still iterable (re-markable in its difference)

MC.content: mark beyond human language [letter still human?]
letter always arrives means the unconscious has no accidents, no internal chance [see p. 375 biogenetics: no randomness, no bastardy]
MC.linkedContent: letter always arrives means the unconscious has no accidents, no internal chance [see p. 375 biogenetics: no randomness, no bastardy]

MC.content: ever since Plato [repression of Democritus, a large symptom?], an organization of the throw: subject/object > repress chance, repress the mark, protect “normality,” isolate a solid context (stereotomy)
MC.linkedContent: ever since Plato [repression of Democritus, a large symptom?], an organization of the throw: subject/object > repress chance, repress the mark, protect “normality,” isolate a solid context (stereotomy)

H.content: read from another angle, not simply a triangle
H.linkedContent: read from another angle, not simply a triangle

SPOM.content: character of the specter cannot be derived from a psychoanalysis of the imaginary
SPOM.linkedContent: character of the specter cannot be derived from a psychoanalysis of the imaginary

PAS.content: viens doesn’t give place to any order, w/out law, w/out anything namable that may be desired, demanded from a lack
PAS.linkedContent: viens doesn’t give place to any order, w/out law, w/out anything namable that may be desired, demanded from a lack

PAS.content: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack
PAS.linkedContent: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack

VP.content: must—refers to “force of law” [see end of Lacan’s Sinthome] [Nietzsche’s transvaluation of values in VP]
VP.linkedContent: must—refers to “force of law” [see end of Lacan’s Sinthome] [Nietzsche’s transvaluation of values in VP]

VP.content: [we can see the letter always arrives in Husserl’s assurance that there must be a formal identity to the sign that allows repetition beyond all empirical deformations]
VP.linkedContent: [we can see the letter always arrives in Husserl’s assurance that there must be a formal identity to the sign that allows repetition beyond all empirical deformations]

FSW.content: must deconstruct linguistic phonologism in psychoanalysis [?]

SH.content: dating amounts to signing; signature marks provenance of what is given (sent), destined (whether or not it arrives) > one signs a date from a given place
SH.linkedContent: dating amounts to signing; signature marks provenance of what is given (sent), destined (whether or not it arrives) > one signs a date from a given place

FWT.content: no opportunism or relativism in fact that Derrida is sometimes allied w/ Lacan, and sometimes in objection
FWT.linkedContent: no opportunism or relativism in fact that Derrida is sometimes allied w/ Lacan, and sometimes in objection

FWT.content: Derrida feels closer to Lacan than Foucault, he’s more daring a “deconstructor” > Foucault’s passage btwn epistemes neglects long sequences (hardens into oppositions)
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida feels closer to Lacan than Foucault, he’s more daring a “deconstructor” > Foucault’s passage btwn epistemes neglects long sequences (hardens into oppositions)

FWT.content: in Derrida’s [torrid relation w/] touching/mistreating (toucher à) the French language, letting himself be touched/mistreated, in his attention not to signifier but to letter, address, destination, mise-en-scène, he is closest to Lacan, but “Lacan is so French!”, “so much more French than I am”
FWT.linkedContent: in Derrida’s [torrid relation w/] touching/mistreating (toucher à) the French language, letting himself be touched/mistreated, in his attention not to signifier but to letter, address, destination, mise-en-scène, he is closest to Lacan, but “Lacan is so French!”, “so much more French than I am”

FWT.content: and Derrida had the maddest love affair w/ the French language
FWT.linkedContent: and Derrida had the maddest love affair w/ the French language

FWT.content: Derrida on why he rarely uses word “freedom” [re: machine]; didn’t Lacan say somewhere he never uses the word?
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida on why he rarely uses word “freedom” [re: machine]; didn’t Lacan say somewhere he never uses the word?

FWT.content: Freud’s grand entities (ego, id, etc.) & Lacan’s grand conceptual oppositions (real, imaginary, symbolic) are too solid, substantialized—differance erases/displaces their borders
FWT.linkedContent: Freud’s grand entities (ego, id, etc.) & Lacan’s grand conceptual oppositions (real, imaginary, symbolic) are too solid, substantialized—differance erases/displaces their borders

FWT.content: for Lacan, madness—limit of human freedom

P.content: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)
P.linkedContent: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)

P.content: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau
P.linkedContent: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau

POS.content: signifier exceeding signified still maintains logocentrism (stuck in phase of overturning hierarchy, not beyond opposition)
POS.linkedContent: signifier exceeding signified still maintains logocentrism (stuck in phase of overturning hierarchy, not beyond opposition)

POS.content: dissemination situates the more or less that resists effect of subjectivity, appropriation > disorganizes, marks writing of Lacan’s “symbolic”: la dissémination figure ce qui ne revient pas au père, affirms endless substitution, does not overlook duplicity, simulacrum [like Lacan’s “symbolic”?]
POS.linkedContent: dissemination situates the more or less that resists effect of subjectivity, appropriation > disorganizes, marks writing of Lacan’s “symbolic”: la dissémination figure ce qui ne revient pas au père, affirms endless substitution, does not overlook duplicity, simulacrum [like Lacan’s “symbolic”?]

POS.content: possibility for a mark to “disembed” itself, “unsew-it,”that which is no longer integrated in “symbolic” > violence & unconscious effects of simulacrum
POS.linkedContent: possibility for a mark to “disembed” itself, “unsew-it,”that which is no longer integrated in “symbolic” > violence & unconscious effects of simulacrum

POS.content: cannot be reclaimed by imaginary, neither veil nor truth, signifier nor signified
POS.linkedContent: cannot be reclaimed by imaginary, neither veil nor truth, signifier nor signified

POS.content: dissemination is play of castration w/out metaphysical/romantic pathos of negativity > dissemination “is” angle of play of castration
POS.linkedContent: dissemination is play of castration w/out metaphysical/romantic pathos of negativity > dissemination “is” angle of play of castration

POS.content: dissemination puts at stake (play) castration’s position as transcendental signifier/signified (phallus, transcendental signifier, as correlate to primary signified, mother’s desire)
POS.linkedContent: dissemination puts at stake (play) castration’s position as transcendental signifier/signified (phallus, transcendental signifier, as correlate to primary signified, mother’s desire)

POS.content: Lacan’s phonocentrism, “full speech,” his uncritical use of Hegel, his “theft” of Derrida’s writing, his elliptical style as one of evasion, “homonymic” feint
POS.linkedContent: Lacan’s phonocentrism, “full speech,” his uncritical use of Hegel, his “theft” of Derrida’s writing, his elliptical style as one of evasion, “homonymic” feint

POS.content: Lacanian triangle: unmodifiable transcendental or ontological structure

ROP.content: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel
ROP.linkedContent: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel

ROP.content: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien
ROP.linkedContent: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien

ROP.content: the dogma/idealism of Lacan’s “letter always arrives,” one can never assemble anything in its indivisibility
ROP.linkedContent: the dogma/idealism of Lacan’s “letter always arrives,” one can never assemble anything in its indivisibility

ROP.content: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)
ROP.linkedContent: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)

ROP.content: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & la restance disséminale, no longer belonging to economy of repression
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & la restance disséminale, no longer belonging to economy of repression

ROP.content: Lacan’s original relation with philosophers (not w/ philosophy), abandoned historiography, staged singular desire of the philosopher, an illumination, a “searchlight effect (coup de phare),” toward which Derrida has great favor/fervor > Lacan was “so much more a philosopher than Freud!”
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan’s original relation with philosophers (not w/ philosophy), abandoned historiography, staged singular desire of the philosopher, an illumination, a “searchlight effect (coup de phare),” toward which Derrida has great favor/fervor > Lacan was “so much more a philosopher than Freud!”

ROP.content: “antiphilosophy” > the thing least deserving of interest in the world
ROP.linkedContent: “antiphilosophy” > the thing least deserving of interest in the world

ROP.content: Derrida quite likes Lacan’s “dit d’ici,” hears didici, Latin, didactic, I will have taught/told you
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida quite likes Lacan’s “dit d’ici,” hears didici, Latin, didactic, I will have taught/told you

ROP.content: Lacanian discourse as most strenuous use of all Derrida finds deconstructible, his discourse the most to be deconstructed: primacy of signifier, logo-, phono-, phallogo-centrism, full speech as truth, circular return of reapproprition towards proper place (whose borders are circumscribed by lack)
ROP.linkedContent: Lacanian discourse as most strenuous use of all Derrida finds deconstructible, his discourse the most to be deconstructed: primacy of signifier, logo-, phono-, phallogo-centrism, full speech as truth, circular return of reapproprition towards proper place (whose borders are circumscribed by lack)

ROP.content: Lacan too at home w/ philosophers, too philosophical, while Derrida was (not breaking with them, but) reconsidering the contracts
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan too at home w/ philosophers, too philosophical, while Derrida was (not breaking with them, but) reconsidering the contracts

ROP.content: too much Sartrian neo-existentialism, too much uncritical Heidegger, too much Hegel/Kojève [Kojève not only anthropologized Phenom…, he Heideggerianized it]
ROP.linkedContent: too much Sartrian neo-existentialism, too much uncritical Heidegger, too much Hegel/Kojève [Kojève not only anthropologized Phenom…, he Heideggerianized it]

ROP.content: the arbitrary 8 motifs [pour faire penser à l'institution de l'infini debout] Derrida finds deconstructible in Lacan: 1) proper, circular return to place of lack 2) truth as adequation 3) “full speech” 4) the mechanical archive as “alienating” 5) transcendental phallus 6) phonocentrism 7) failure to account for literary structure of narration 8) a “spiriting away” of double in Poe, which would have brought symbolic and imaginary closer together, thus blurred tripartite as well
ROP.linkedContent: the arbitrary 8 motifs [pour faire penser à l'institution de l'infini debout] Derrida finds deconstructible in Lacan: 1) proper, circular return to place of lack 2) truth as adequation 3) “full speech” 4) the mechanical archive as “alienating” 5) transcendental phallus 6) phonocentrism 7) failure to account for literary structure of narration 8) a “spiriting away” of double in Poe, which would have brought symbolic and imaginary closer together, thus blurred tripartite as well

ROP.content: idealism of the indivisibility of the letter, “the materiality of the signifier,” the place of the signifier
ROP.linkedContent: idealism of the indivisibility of the letter, “the materiality of the signifier,” the place of the signifier

ROP.content: everyone, Ponge, Blanchot, Lacan (incomparable listener) tried to replace speech w/ writing after Derrida, to replace phoneme w/ grapheme is overcompensatory > trace, gramme, differance no more graphic than phonematic
ROP.linkedContent: everyone, Ponge, Blanchot, Lacan (incomparable listener) tried to replace speech w/ writing after Derrida, to replace phoneme w/ grapheme is overcompensatory > trace, gramme, differance no more graphic than phonematic

ROP.content: Derrida agrees w/ Lacan that there is one libido (as Freud first argued), it is the question of reason, principle of reason > d'un trait tiré de la raison ou d'une traite tirée [check drawn] sur la raison
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida agrees w/ Lacan that there is one libido (as Freud first argued), it is the question of reason, principle of reason > d'un trait tiré de la raison ou d'une traite tirée [check drawn] sur la raison

ROP.content: in EN, in interminable conversation w/ Lacan, Derrida thinks contingency, singularity, event, tukhē, which is also a thinking of death, whose signifier would be the phallus
ROP.linkedContent: in EN, in interminable conversation w/ Lacan, Derrida thinks contingency, singularity, event, tukhē, which is also a thinking of death, whose signifier would be the phallus

ROP.content: [quoting EN] Derrida will not accept Heidegger’s being-for-death nor Lacan’s, latter linked to phallocentered signifier
ROP.linkedContent: [quoting EN] Derrida will not accept Heidegger’s being-for-death nor Lacan’s, latter linked to phallocentered signifier

ROP.content: [quoting EN] Lacanian scandal re: what he says on the animal: en un mot, that death happens to the immortal who lacks for lacking nothing, not to the mortal being-for-death [?]
ROP.linkedContent: [quoting EN] Lacanian scandal re: what he says on the animal: en un mot, that death happens to the immortal who lacks for lacking nothing, not to the mortal being-for-death [?]

ROP.content: [quoting EN] difference “w/” Lacan: the lack does not have its place in dissemination
ROP.linkedContent: [quoting EN] difference “w/” Lacan: the lack does not have its place in dissemination

ROP.content: Lacan returns to an unsurpassability of Descartes, brings Descartes close to Freud > [is this part of Foucault’ critique of psychoanalysis? re: subject (of science)]
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan returns to an unsurpassability of Descartes, brings Descartes close to Freud > [is this part of Foucault’ critique of psychoanalysis? re: subject (of science)]

SP.content: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil
SP.linkedContent: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil

ATIA.content: those who wish, out of desire or need, to make an ironclad distinction btwn desire/need
ATIA.linkedContent: those who wish, out of desire or need, to make an ironclad distinction btwn desire/need

ATIA.content: Derrida introduces Adorno’s attack on Kant’s cruelty, compares it to Lacan’s Kant Avec Sade, though points out that Lacan not concerned w/ Kant’s cruelty towards animals
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida introduces Adorno’s attack on Kant’s cruelty, compares it to Lacan’s Kant Avec Sade, though points out that Lacan not concerned w/ Kant’s cruelty towards animals

ATIA.content: Lacan marks, perhaps, a step beyond and step this side of Freud re: relation among the human, unconscious, and animot
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan marks, perhaps, a step beyond and step this side of Freud re: relation among the human, unconscious, and animot

ATIA.content: for Lacan, mirror (imaginary) is enough to bring an animal from solitary to gregarious form (which is not social); animal does not have unconscious, language, sometimes develops it through domestic transference [?]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, mirror (imaginary) is enough to bring an animal from solitary to gregarious form (which is not social); animal does not have unconscious, language, sometimes develops it through domestic transference [?]

ATIA.content: for Lacan, man’s “autotelic specularity of the inside is thus linked to a defect, to a prematurity, to an incompleteness of the little man”
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, man’s “autotelic specularity of the inside is thus linked to a defect, to a prematurity, to an incompleteness of the little man”

ATIA.content: for Derrida, “fixity” of code [automaticity of iterability], is well put by Lacan, but put in the wrong place: Derrida wants to inscribe it beyond strict opposition animal/man
ATIA.linkedContent: for Derrida, “fixity” of code [automaticity of iterability], is well put by Lacan, but put in the wrong place: Derrida wants to inscribe it beyond strict opposition animal/man

ATIA.content: Derrida has problem w/ fact that Lacan’s ethics, the subject, founded on distinction btwn reaction/response > destiny of iterability: automaticity of reaction in every response
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida has problem w/ fact that Lacan’s ethics, the subject, founded on distinction btwn reaction/response > destiny of iterability: automaticity of reaction in every response

ATIA.content: Derrida affirms Lacan’s “the subject receives even the message he emits [from the Other]” as a way to inscribe reaction/response in all vicissitudes of the living
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida affirms Lacan’s “the subject receives even the message he emits [from the Other]” as a way to inscribe reaction/response in all vicissitudes of the living

ATIA.content: for Lacan, animal can inscribe the trace but not erase it [for Derrida inscription erases itself, mechanically, this is iterability]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, animal can inscribe the trace but not erase it [for Derrida inscription erases itself, mechanically, this is iterability]

ATIA.content: Lacan and Heidegger both think animals can’t die [cf. p. 154 Heidegger implies animal unique from rock because of possibility of dying (sterben)]
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan and Heidegger both think animals can’t die [cf. p. 154 Heidegger implies animal unique from rock because of possibility of dying (sterben)]

ATIA.content: for Lacan, move from animal to human (to speech, to truth, to symbolic order): abyssal concept of a feined feint or pretended pretense (not merely the figure or simple feint)
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, move from animal to human (to speech, to truth, to symbolic order): abyssal concept of a feined feint or pretended pretense (not merely the figure or simple feint)

ATIA.content: Levinas’ 3rd party, an other of the other, in contrast to Lacan’s “there is no Other of the Other” > but, for both of them, what about the animal-other?
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas’ 3rd party, an other of the other, in contrast to Lacan’s “there is no Other of the Other” > but, for both of them, what about the animal-other?

ATIA.content: dogma: to assert w/out appealing to testimony or knowledge (which are different) [re: Lacan’s distinction btwn pretense & pretense of pretense] [Derrida wonders if the dogmatism is here inspired by the difficulty/impossibility of discernment re: pretense]
ATIA.linkedContent: dogma: to assert w/out appealing to testimony or knowledge (which are different) [re: Lacan’s distinction btwn pretense & pretense of pretense] [Derrida wonders if the dogmatism is here inspired by the difficulty/impossibility of discernment re: pretense]

ATIA.content: for Lacan, what is great about Descartes’ cogito is that the sum is transcendental, it’s beyond imaginary capture (the animal’s cogito, w/out sum, w/out “I”), the specular > [it is symbolic]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, what is great about Descartes’ cogito is that the sum is transcendental, it’s beyond imaginary capture (the animal’s cogito, w/out sum, w/out “I”), the specular > [it is symbolic]

ATIA.content: Lacan’s “generic prematuration of birth,” essential genesis of man’s castration complex > this “generic” trait, man escaping genre, by means of dé-génération (not degeneracy), whose defect engenders symbolic “generation” (law of Name, Father, Speech, Truth, Deceit)
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan’s “generic prematuration of birth,” essential genesis of man’s castration complex > this “generic” trait, man escaping genre, by means of dé-génération (not degeneracy), whose defect engenders symbolic “generation” (law of Name, Father, Speech, Truth, Deceit)

O.content: same denial at work in Greater Logic when preface is placed in parentheses as when psychoanalytic phallocentrism places anatomy in parentheses?
O.linkedContent: same denial at work in Greater Logic when preface is placed in parentheses as when psychoanalytic phallocentrism places anatomy in parentheses?

O.content: is pleasure literary in essence? if Vorlust, foreplay, prime (bonus) of seduction, formal moment of literature, ne se comble qu’à la fin du plaisir, then jouissance would be instance of seduction, prime supplémentaire de rien d’autre: pleasure a formal, threshold phenomena, nul et sans fins, a repression lifted & maintained > graphics of hymen questions all couples, all oppositions (especially those of Freud)
O.linkedContent: is pleasure literary in essence? if Vorlust, foreplay, prime (bonus) of seduction, formal moment of literature, ne se comble qu’à la fin du plaisir, then jouissance would be instance of seduction, prime supplémentaire de rien d’autre: pleasure a formal, threshold phenomena, nul et sans fins, a repression lifted & maintained > graphics of hymen questions all couples, all oppositions (especially those of Freud)

DPi.content: Derrida scolds Lacan for relegating Nietzsche to “cheap junk (la pacotille)”
DPi.linkedContent: Derrida scolds Lacan for relegating Nietzsche to “cheap junk (la pacotille)”

CHM.content: “the fact of language is probably the only fact ultimately to resist all parenthization” [letter always arrives?]
CHM.linkedContent: “the fact of language is probably the only fact ultimately to resist all parenthization” [letter always arrives?]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: subject in mirror is first of all subject in désistance, figure is never one, destabilizing division of figural (this muddles Lacan’s distinction btwn symbolic/imaginary)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: subject in mirror is first of all subject in désistance, figure is never one, destabilizing division of figural (this muddles Lacan’s distinction btwn symbolic/imaginary)

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: [subject] ‘desists’ because must confront at least 2 figures (or one figure that is at least double) > destabilizing Lacan’s imaginary/symbolic
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: [subject] ‘desists’ because must confront at least 2 figures (or one figure that is at least double) > destabilizing Lacan’s imaginary/symbolic

DST.content: via Lacoue-Labarthe, Lacan’s theoreticism, which is inscribed in the ontology of the figure, Lacan’s recasting of Freud to the gaze, the specular > an ontomimetological interpretation of mimesis
DST.linkedContent: via Lacoue-Labarthe, Lacan’s theoreticism, which is inscribed in the ontology of the figure, Lacan’s recasting of Freud to the gaze, the specular > an ontomimetological interpretation of mimesis

DST.content: the “loss (perte) of the subject” in Lacan calls for a suturing that obliterates désistance
DST.linkedContent: the “loss (perte) of the subject” in Lacan calls for a suturing that obliterates désistance

PIO.content: [re: “Fable”] no metalanguage: essential instability, rapid oscillation btwn performative/constative (fiction/nonfiction), constitutes event > disturbs norms, rules, statues
PIO.linkedContent: [re: “Fable”] no metalanguage: essential instability, rapid oscillation btwn performative/constative (fiction/nonfiction), constitutes event > disturbs norms, rules, statues

TR.content: “free signifier” ribbon like Lacan’s purloined letter: content is not important
TR.linkedContent: “free signifier” ribbon like Lacan’s purloined letter: content is not important

TR.content: de Man’s dissociating metonymic structure (deconstruction of metaphor) (Lacan, Deleuze-like)
TR.linkedContent: de Man’s dissociating metonymic structure (deconstruction of metaphor) (Lacan, Deleuze-like)

TR.content: for de Man, deconstruction wherever metaphorical totality shifts to metonymical aggregate
TR.linkedContent: for de Man, deconstruction wherever metaphorical totality shifts to metonymical aggregate

TR.content: de Man: deconstruction/dissemination independent of any desire (mechanical/arbitrary like a grammar) [Derrida quickly claims this argument is both defensible & indefensible]
TR.linkedContent: de Man: deconstruction/dissemination independent of any desire (mechanical/arbitrary like a grammar) [Derrida quickly claims this argument is both defensible & indefensible]

TR.content: event supposes the arbitrary & exteriority to desire
TR.linkedContent: event supposes the arbitrary & exteriority to desire

AFR.content: Condillac: need as uneasiness caused by absence of object you deem necessary [lack], this uneasiness determines actions of body’s/soul’s faculties, this determination is desire
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: need as uneasiness caused by absence of object you deem necessary [lack], this uneasiness determines actions of body’s/soul’s faculties, this determination is desire

PJP.content: honesty of father: knowing himself to be dead [“us”?] > perjurer as symbolic orphan of father [baby daddy]: this knowledge pursued him in advance, he followed the knowing-oneself death of the father [everywhere]
PJP.linkedContent: honesty of father: knowing himself to be dead [“us”?] > perjurer as symbolic orphan of father [baby daddy]: this knowledge pursued him in advance, he followed the knowing-oneself death of the father [everywhere]

PSSS.content: pleasure/reality principle—same in differance > cruelty drive more ancient than principles?
PSSS.linkedContent: pleasure/reality principle—same in differance > cruelty drive more ancient than principles?

PSSS.content: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)
PSSS.linkedContent: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)

PSSS.content: “I can,” “I may,” mastery of performative, dominates/neutralizes (in order of “symbolic,” symbolically) the event it produces
PSSS.linkedContent: “I can,” “I may,” mastery of performative, dominates/neutralizes (in order of “symbolic,” symbolically) the event it produces

PSSS.content: wherever there is law & performative, event has been neutralized, reappropriated by performative force or symbolic order
PSSS.linkedContent: wherever there is law & performative, event has been neutralized, reappropriated by performative force or symbolic order

+R.content: double ladder, erected, riveted, shackled, never arrives > steps: symbolic of sexual act [no sexual rapport?]
+R.linkedContent: double ladder, erected, riveted, shackled, never arrives > steps: symbolic of sexual act [no sexual rapport?]

C.content: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition
C.linkedContent: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition

C.content: “things won’t stop computing in me,” Derrida wants to touch the necessity of the contingency of Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins [compare to Lacan’s: can’t stop being-written]
C.linkedContent: “things won’t stop computing in me,” Derrida wants to touch the necessity of the contingency of Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins [compare to Lacan’s: can’t stop being-written]

TN.content: caress, to take or give pleasure?; the order/command “Tiens!” [TN. there, here, hold on to this, take it] is not the same order as tact (the trembling, relinquishment [dessaisissement] at heart of seizing [saisie]) [beyond Lacan’s: “never give up on your desire”?]
TN.linkedContent: caress, to take or give pleasure?; the order/command “Tiens!” [TN. there, here, hold on to this, take it] is not the same order as tact (the trembling, relinquishment [dessaisissement] at heart of seizing [saisie]) [beyond Lacan’s: “never give up on your desire”?]

BSi.content: [Derrida disputes Lacan’s “animals cannot cross certain threshold of dissimulation”]
BSi.linkedContent: [Derrida disputes Lacan’s “animals cannot cross certain threshold of dissimulation”]

BSi.content: Lacan’s “return” to Freud [proclaimed loyalty to psychoanalytic tradition] both helps us & forbids us from thinking
BSi.linkedContent: Lacan’s “return” to Freud [proclaimed loyalty to psychoanalytic tradition] both helps us & forbids us from thinking

BSi.content: to uniquely human “I” of Descartes and Kant, Lacan adds superego (Law/Crime) > i.e. animals don’t have superego
BSi.linkedContent: to uniquely human “I” of Descartes and Kant, Lacan adds superego (Law/Crime) > i.e. animals don’t have superego

BSi.content: Lacan’s “fellow” [?] seems to follow Greco-Abrahamic, & especially Christian, notion of “neighbor,” “brother,” as totality of all creatures [re: when we treat animal as “fellow”]
BSi.linkedContent: Lacan’s “fellow” [?] seems to follow Greco-Abrahamic, & especially Christian, notion of “neighbor,” “brother,” as totality of all creatures [re: when we treat animal as “fellow”]

BSi.content: Lacan accused Derrida of “coupling” [?] Torok & Abraham
BSi.linkedContent: Lacan accused Derrida of “coupling” [?] Torok & Abraham

OG.content: writing as “signifier of the signifier” no longer means accidental doubling, fallen (déchue) secondarity, but overflows, goes beyond extension of language > comprehends language
OG.linkedContent: writing as “signifier of the signifier” no longer means accidental doubling, fallen (déchue) secondarity, but overflows, goes beyond extension of language > comprehends language

OG.content: signified always already (toujours déjà) functions as signifier: effacing = overflowing
OG.linkedContent: signified always already (toujours déjà) functions as signifier: effacing = overflowing

OG.content: secondarity of writing effects all signifieds
advent of writing, advent of a play which effaces all those abris du hors-jeu (out-of-bounds shelters [transcendental signifieds]) that surveil field of language > destroying the concept sign
OG.linkedContent: advent of writing, advent of a play which effaces all those abris du hors-jeu (out-of-bounds shelters [transcendental signifieds]) that surveil field of language > destroying the concept sign

OG.content: at limit, if we try to claim the signifier is prior to the signified [reversing the classical structure], the whole concept of sign is destroyed
OG.linkedContent: at limit, if we try to claim the signifier is prior to the signified [reversing the classical structure], the whole concept of sign is destroyed

OG.content: to declare “primacy” of signifier w/in a logic that privileges the signified is absurd
OG.linkedContent: to declare “primacy” of signifier w/in a logic that privileges the signified is absurd

OG.content: split of signifier/signified as naive critique of loss of presence [no matter which side of opposition is privileged]
OG.linkedContent: split of signifier/signified as naive critique of loss of presence [no matter which side of opposition is privileged]

SPEC.content: [for Freud?] no mélange of pleasure–unpleasure is possible, mélange is madness > though topical distribution [in Beyond…] is effect of differance, it retains differance in reassuring medium & in oppositional logic > principle of identity is respected by topology, division of sites
SPEC.linkedContent: [for Freud?] no mélange of pleasure–unpleasure is possible, mélange is madness > though topical distribution [in Beyond…] is effect of differance, it retains differance in reassuring medium & in oppositional logic > principle of identity is respected by topology, division of sites

SPEC.content: the unanalyzed remainder of an unconscious remains [re: Freud’s autobiographical, writing], Derrida: “je parie” that it will be transmitted blindly by all who “return to Freud”: remainder that works the scene is illegible—i.e., restance, yet the only urgency of what reste à faire
SPEC.linkedContent: the unanalyzed remainder of an unconscious remains [re: Freud’s autobiographical, writing], Derrida: “je parie” that it will be transmitted blindly by all who “return to Freud”: remainder that works the scene is illegible—i.e., restance, yet the only urgency of what reste à faire

SPEC.content: postal relay (relais) makes it possible for letter not to arrive, divides structure of letter from outset (d’entrée), neither relay nor analysis if letter were indivisible & always arrived
SPEC.linkedContent: postal relay (relais) makes it possible for letter not to arrive, divides structure of letter from outset (d’entrée), neither relay nor analysis if letter were indivisible & always arrived

SPEC.content: several families (in French analytic movement) bear same name [Freud’s name?] w/out knowing it [via Marie Bonaparte; “au moment où on croit décacheter (unsealed) un testament”]
SPEC.linkedContent: several families (in French analytic movement) bear same name [Freud’s name?] w/out knowing it [via Marie Bonaparte; “au moment où on croit décacheter (unsealed) un testament”]

SPEC.content: all the interlacings of fort:da, tout ce qui s’envoi in graphics of repetition that dislocates summary “triangle” > le trait oedipien n’est qu’une rection pour le fil conducteur de la bobine [Oedipus most narrowly restricted effects of above repetition’s graphics]
SPEC.linkedContent: all the interlacings of fort:da, tout ce qui s’envoi in graphics of repetition that dislocates summary “triangle” > le trait oedipien n’est qu’une rection pour le fil conducteur de la bobine [Oedipus most narrowly restricted effects of above repetition’s graphics]

SPEC.content: Freud’s “to let develop” [re: Aristophanes’ speech] mortgages irresponsibility, no engagement, epokhē of judgment, speaks from no-place [Lacan takes Beyond… too seriously?]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s “to let develop” [re: Aristophanes’ speech] mortgages irresponsibility, no engagement, epokhē of judgment, speaks from no-place [Lacan takes Beyond… too seriously?]

FV.content: for Lacan, truth inhabits fiction [Derrida exposes limitation of this stance]
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, truth inhabits fiction [Derrida exposes limitation of this stance]

FV.content: all Lacan’s work takes problematic of Freud’s Beyond…seriously

Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]
FV.linkedContent: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]

FV.content: letter has no proper meaning, volante, volée; Lacan claims the letter isn’t content w/ having meaning > Derrida intends to show that w/ Lacan the letter is content to have one meaning, and one alone
FV.linkedContent: letter has no proper meaning, volante, volée; Lacan claims the letter isn’t content w/ having meaning > Derrida intends to show that w/ Lacan the letter is content to have one meaning, and one alone

FV.content: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier

FV.content: [Derrida’s syntactical deconstruction of Lacan] re: letter, manque à sa place [missing from its place] becomes manque a sa place [lack has its place] ——brief glance re: Lacan’s advances: breaks w/ naive semanticism & psychobiographism, elaborates logic of signifier, includes problematic of Freud’s Beyond…
FV.linkedContent: [Derrida’s syntactical deconstruction of Lacan] re: letter, manque à sa place [missing from its place] becomes manque a sa place [lack has its place] ——brief glance re: Lacan’s advances: breaks w/ naive semanticism & psychobiographism, elaborates logic of signifier, includes problematic of Freud’s Beyond…

FV.content: even Freud [thus not Lacan] indicates, in Das Unheimliche, literary fiction’s resistance to general law of psychoanalytic knowledge
FV.linkedContent: even Freud [thus not Lacan] indicates, in Das Unheimliche, literary fiction’s resistance to general law of psychoanalytic knowledge
